content.webTitle: Best pictures of the day - live

fields.headline: Best pictures of the day - live
fields.bodyText: Picture from the past: Dorothea Lange died on 11 October 1965 and we remember her work in our Pictures from the past today. Lange is best known for her work during the Great Depression and her photographs drew attention to the plight of the migrant workers. Salami river: the Experimental Food Society Spectacular culinary event takes place in London in November. Here's a taste of what will be on offer in our gallery... it's enough to get the taste buds going Name that church: try our travel picture quiz and see how many of these churches around the world you can name WildPhotos 2013: The Royal Geographic Society is hosting the WildPhotos event including workshops and lectures and featuring guest speakers. Our gallery features some of the amazing photographs taken by some of the speakers Knights of Jerusalem: the festival, now in its fifth year, features re-enactments of medieval battles. Enthusiasts from around the world descend on Jersusalem to take part. See more images in our gallery. See even more in our From the Agencies series Today's Eyewitness is from Owen Humphreys and he tells us how he took the photograph I got up at 6.30am to catch the high tide at 7.27am and I shot the picture at 8.21am. The news had reports of high seas and possible breaching of the sea walls around the north-east coast [of England]. I chose Seaburn as my location due to the direction the sea was being taken on the north-east winds. The picture shows Seaburn Park lighthouse which is set much higher than sea level however the high sea's were reaching the 15 metre high lighthouse built in 1903. The picture was shot at 1600asa At f4.5 at 320th on Nikon D4 on a 70-200 lens at 125 ml on manual exposure. Postman Pat has taken some time off his day job to sell Royal Mail shares as they made a spectacular debut on the London Stock Market. Our photographer David Levene has sent us this Instagram picture as he visited a trading floor this morning. You can follow the latest in our live business blog
